snippet: President Obama, who met with Ukraine’s interim prime minister Wednesday, was pursuing a diplomatic approach that could deliver more autonomy to Crimea if Russian troops withdraw.
abstract: Pres Obama hosts Ukraine's interim Prime Min Arseniy P Yatsenyuk at the White House and the two open door to a political solution that could lead to more autonomy for Crimea if Russian troops withdraw; meeting comes as the United States embarks on a last-ditch diplomatic effort to defuse a crisis that has reignited tensions between East and West.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman and Annie Lowrey contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Obama, who met with Ukraine’s interim prime minister Wednesday, was pursuing a diplomatic approach that could deliver more autonomy to Crimea if Russian troops withdraw.

headline.main: Obama Makes Push for Political Solution to Crisis in Ukraine
headline.print_headline: Obama Makes Diplomatic Push to Defuse Crisis in Ukraine
